kw.name: Clear Existing Data
kw.doc: Clear existing data from the database for testing purposes

kw.name: Connect To Database
kw.doc: Loads the DB API 2.0 module given `dbapiModuleName` then uses it to connect to the database using `dbName`, `dbUsername`, and `dbPassword`.
kw.msg: Connecting using : pymysql.connect(db=rpa_db, user=robocop, passwd=RPA.Password, host=localhost, port=3306, charset=None)

kw.name: Set Variable
kw.doc: Returns the given values which can then be assigned to a variables.

kw.name: Execute Sql String
kw.doc: Executes the sqlString as SQL commands. Useful to pass arguments to your sql. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback.
kw.msg: Executing : Execute SQL String | DELETE FROM invoicerow

kw.msg: Executing : Execute SQL String | INSERT INTO invoicerow (invoicenumber, rownumber, description, quantity, unit, unitprice, vatpercent, vat, total) VALUES ('1543235', '2', 'Brother printer', 1, 'kpl', 65, 24, 15.6, 80.6)

kw.name: Split String
kw.doc: Splits the ``string`` using ``separator`` as a delimiter string.

kw.name: Catenate
kw.arg: INSERT INTO invoicerow (invoicenumber, rownumber, description, quantity, unit, unitprice, vatpercent, vat, total) VALUES ('${rowDetails[7]}', '${rowDetails[8]}', '${rowDetails[0]}', ${rowDetails[1]}, '${rowDetails[2]}', ${rowDetails[3]}, ${rowDetails[4]}, ${rowDetails[5]}, ${rowDetails[6]})
kw.doc: Catenates the given items together and returns the resulted string.
kw.msg: ${query} = INSERT INTO invoicerow (invoicenumber, rownumber, description, quantity, unit, unitprice, vatpercent, vat, total) VALUES ('153143', '1', 'Installation Services', 5, 'h', 60, 24, 72, 372)
